Title:
Phylogenetic position of the Ancash-eared mouse, Phyllotis
definitus Osgood 1915 (Rodentia: Cricetidae).
Abstract:
The phylogenetic position of the Ancash Leaf-eared mouse
Phyllotis definitus remains unresolved, as this species has been
considered to be related to P. magister, P. xanthopygus or P. andium by
several authors. The objective of this study was to clarify the
phylogenetic position of P. definitus using 801 base pairs of cytochrome
- b sequences. A matrix constituted by 43 specimens was subjected to
maximum likelihood, maximum parsimony, and Bayesian inference analyses.
Our results indicate that P. definitus is a member of the
“andium/amicus” group and is closely related to P. pearsoni, supporting
a set of chromosomal and morphological characters previously identified
for this group.
